To speed up signing, the admin used a low exponent with RSA. Can you recover the original message from this signature? Ciphertext: 0x48e2333337deb7090c816e28f20943cbf1439082bf9b226481805060d15592e21c7b7f5f79631e868eac0f037a020d12f31aaab7acfe7c2848e2d3b9e0792ee0

Public Key (n, e): (8826225297669486372049934049255518922423291760642645130837770472736495729341924407251155002922125365896705400377653865107261552229224293208660250528069053, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{kmg8e9xa}
ciphertext: 0x48e2333337deb7090c816e28f20943cbf1439082bf9b226481805060d15592e21c7b7f5f79631e868eac0f037a020d12f31aaab7acfe7c2848e2d3b9e0792ee0
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (8826225297669486372049934049255518922423291760642645130837770472736495729341924407251155002922125365896705400377653865107261552229224293208660250528069053, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
